title: Epitaph for Eupolemos
support: Stele of the local stone, damaged below, forming part of an eptymbion ('type B')

layout.p: Single line of Greek letters filling the width of the stone

handNote.lettering: Plain letters carved in a deep square cut: E has shorter mid-bar; upsilon slightly exceeds the line; pi is wide and square in form, with fractionally shorter right hasta; omicron is only slightly smaller than the other letters; mu has vertical first and last strokes, while the mid-strokes descend less than half-way.

date._: The goods recovered from the tomb suggest a date in the 3rd century BCE

provenanceFound._: Tomb 32 of the necropolis in contrada Cardusa

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Santi Furnari di Tripi
museum.description: The neatly-curated collection derives entirely from the Hellenistic necropolis of ancient Abakainon on the outskirts of the modern town of Tripi. The high acidity of the soil has stripped many of the ceramics of their surface decoration, and there is an understandable focus on the metal items (gold and iron) and the stone stele and moulded bases. The collection is arranged over 4 rooms and one corridor on two levels of a restored palazzo, and is equipped with a number of IT panels
